Oxford St will be closed through Darlinghurst for Sydney WorldPride events on Saturday and Sunday, delays are expected in the area and detours will be in place via Surry Hills and Potts Point so allow plenty of extra travel time. Traffic will also be heavy between the city and Bondi as thousands of attendees travel to Bondi Beach for a WorldPride concert.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before kick off and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will be closed for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways will also be in effect throughout Darlinghurst and the city while the WorldPride street party is held on Oxford Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

Significant delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. Fans are strongly urged to catch public transport to avoid the traffic delays.

CAR PARK UPDATE: All car parks in the precinct have sold out for Saturday 4 March. If you haven't pre-booked you'll need to catch public transport as there will be no parking available on site. Consider parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train or bus to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked follow directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

If you're attending on Sunday fans are still encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the eve.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Redfern St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, George St and Glover St will also be closed during this time.
  • Pitt St will remain open to allow traffic to cross Redfern St.
  • Motorists travelling west will be detoured via Chalmers St, Cleveland St and Regent St. Motorists travelling east will be detoured via Regent St, Botany Rd and Raglan St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

REDFERN

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • Renwick St 1 between Turner St and Redfern St
  • Renwick St 1 between Redfern St and Wells St
  • George St 1 between Turner St and Redfern St
  • George St 1 between Wells St and Turner St
  • Glover Lane 1 between Turner St and Redfern St

Notes:

1. Resident access maintained.

Note: Pitt St will remain open in both directions crossing Redfern St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


SURRY HILLS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • George St between Turner St and Wells St
  • Renwick St 22 metres south of Redfern St
  • Renwick St 22 metres north of Redfern St

Harry Styles concerts at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open 5pm, ahead of support act starting from 7:20pm, finish around 10pm.

With more 70,000 fans expected on Friday and more than 100,000 on Saturday due to multiple concerts in the precinct, significant traffic delays on roads approaching the precinct each night.

Significant delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. Fans are strongly urged to catch public transport to avoid the traffic delays.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the event. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

CAR PARK UPDATE: All car parks in the precinct have sold out for Friday 3 and Saturday 4 March. If you haven't pre-booked you'll need to catch public transport as there will be no parking available on site. Travel on transport is included in concert tickets. Consider parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train or bus to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked follow directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

properties.publicTransport:
Public transport is included in attendees’ tickets to the event, even if you’re travelling from Sydney.

Extra train, bus, ferry and light rail services scheduled to help visitors get to and from the event. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

Unlike the 2019 Newcastle 500, a park and ride option from Broadmeadow (McDonald Jones Stadium) to the circuit will not be available this year.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 150,000 people are expected to attend the Supercars Newcastle 500 around the Newcastle East Foreshore from Friday 10 to Sunday 12 March.

Delays are expected on the M1 Motorway and Pacific Hwy on approach to Newcastle as crowds arrive and leave, particularly on Saturday and Sunday mornings. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect on roads inside and outside the circuit for the 3-day event. 

ROAD CLOSURES, LOCAL ACCESS AND PARKING RESTRICTIONS

  • From 7am Tuesday 28 February to 5pm Friday 17 March: closure of Warf Road between Nobbys Road to Pasha Way
  •  From 4am Sunday 5 to 6am Tuesday 14 March: roads east of Watt St along the racetrack will operate under one-way traffic conditions. Parking along the racing circuit is strictly prohibited
  • From 7am Wednesday 8 March to 6pm Monday 13 March: Closure of Wharf Road between Argyle Street and Watt Street 
  •  From 5am Sunday 5 March to 11pm Tuesday 14 March: Closure of Reserve Road/Watt Street between York Drive and James Fletcher Hospital 
  •  From 7am to 7pm Thursday 9 March, 7am to 10pm Friday 10 March, 7am to 11pm Saturday 11 March and 7am to 7pm Sunday 12 March and Monday 13 March: Closure of Hunter Street and Scott Street (eastbound) between Darby Street and Murray Avenue
  • From 7am to 7pm daily from Friday 10 to Sunday 12 March: Westbound lanes of Scott Street closed from Watt Street to Wolfe Street, Newcomen Street north of Hunter Street Mall and Bolton Street between King and Scott Streets
  • From 7am to 7pm daily Friday 10, Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 March: Church Street closed between Newcomen and Watt Streets
  •  From 7am to 7pm each day on Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 March: Closure of roads north of King Street including sections of Brown, Perkins, Thorn and Newcomen Streets
  • From 7am to 7pm daily Friday 10 to Sunday 12 March: all roads east of Bolton Street will close. You cannot drive your vehicle on roads in the circuit during race hours. Outside of race hours access in and out of the circuit across Watt Street is via King Street (entry only) and Scott Street (exit only) for Official Supercars Vehicle Access Passholders or rideshare vehicles only. 

Please note: Traffic controllers will be on-site to permit residents through the closure points for access to properties on Scott Street and nearby roads. Access properties on Scott Street between Newcomen Street and Brown Street via Wolfe Street or Newcomen Street from King Street. Access properties on Scott Street between Watt Street and Newcomen Street via Bolton Street from King Street. 

Special event clearways are in place for track construction and will continue for the event weekend, starting from 5am Friday 10 March and run until 11pm Sunday 12 March 2023. Motorists are advised to check signs before parking as vehicles in special event clearways will be towed and fines apply.

An interactive road closure and clearway map is available in the links.

What are special event clearways?

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply to all vehicles, including residents with local parking permits and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. They are put in place to provide extra road space for the event and to remove vehicles from the precinct for public safety. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

FIND OUT MORE

For event enquiries contact community@supercars.com or call 02 8346 2676.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Road, Hunter Street, Scott Street, King Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses will start and end trips either side of the Harbour Bridge in North Sydney and in the city while its closed to traffic - catch trains to continue across the bridge. Travel on transport is included for event participants. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney WorldPride Pride March will see 50,000 participants march across the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

The Harbour Bridge and major roads in the city and North Sydney will be closed from 4am.

The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open however delays are expected. Motorists are urged to avoid the area until after midday where possible.

Key road closures

  • From 2am to 12.30pm: sections of Pacific Hwy at North Sydney near Harbour Bridge off-ramp
  • From 4am to 11:30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions including the Cahill Expressway Circular Overpass. In North Sydney, sections of Walker St, Blue St, Arthur St, Hill St and Pacific Hwy will close. In the Sydney CBD, Art Gallery Rd, Boomerang Pl, Hospital Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary’s Rd and Yurong Pkwy will close.
  • From 4am to 12pm: roads in the Sydney CBD including sections of Macquarie St, Bridge St, Hunter St, College St, Conservatorium Rd, Phillip Ln, St James Rd and Prince Albert Rd.
  • There will be no access between the Cahill Expressway and Macquarie St until after 12pm. Motorists travelling eastbound on the Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass will be diverted via the Domain Tunnel. 
  • From 6am to 11.30am: Bent St cross Macquarie St to Shakespeare Place will close - motorists can use Park St/William St to travel east and west of the city.

The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway will remain open. The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Walkway will close from 6am to 11am.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various key roads in the city and North Sydney between 1am and 12pm.

  • In North Sydney from 1am to 11.30am: on sections of Arthur St, Berry St, Blue St, Broughton St, Falcon St, Lavender St, Middlemiss St, Miller St, Mount St Olympic Drive, Pacific Hwy and Walker St. Some clearways will be in effect from 12.30am on Pacific Hwy.
  • In Sydney CBD from 1am to 12pm: on sections of Bent St, Bridge St, Castlereagh St, College St, Conservatorium Rd, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Park St, Prince Albert Rd, Shakespeare Place, St James Rd and St Mary’s Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR

FROM 4:00AM TO 11:30AM

Connecting ramps between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed. Access will be maintained to Sydney CBD via Anzac Bridge and the Pyrmont St and Fig St on ramps, exiting to the Bathurst St and King St off ramps.

Western Distributor approaches to King Street Wharf

Motorists will be able to access King St Wharf precinct via Erskine St and Wheat Rd. Erskine St is the recommended approach as the Wheat Rd approaches are expected to become heavier as the morning progresses.

Wheat Rd approaches:

·       from the Western Distributor - Bathurst St exit: left via the slip lane onto the Western Distributor then left into Wheat Rd. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge.

·       from Harbour St northbound at Bathurst St: managed access straight ahead then left into Wheat Rd. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge

3 Managed access available to Wheat Rd for King St Wharf and Barangaroo South precincts.

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run regularly between Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Travel on transport is included in your event ticket. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride's Bondi Beach party will be held near Bondi Pavilion on Saturday 4 March. The event starts from 3pm finishing by 10pm.

With more than 15,000 people expected traffic approaching Bondi Beach will be heavy along Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Motorists should avoid the area where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time and prepare for delays. 

Local roads and carparks at Bondi Beach will be closed before, during and after the event between 27 Feb and 5 Mar including sections of Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Drive South. In North Bondi, the Medland-Bamford Ramp from Military Rd will be closed from 6am to 6pm on Saturday.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads between 10am and 11pm on Saturday including Campbell Pde, Bondi Rd, Gould St, Edgecliff Rd, Grafton St, Hall St, Notts Ave and Roscoe St. Clearways will also be in effect prior to the event on Park Dr South from 27 Feb and Queen Elizabeth Dr from 3 Mar.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney WorldPride - Oxford Street Party & Pride Villages

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around Oxford St in both directions. Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride's Oxford Street Party will see Oxford St closed to all vehicle traffic for two days on Saturday 4 and Sunday 5 March.

Motorists will be diverted via Kings Cross or Surry Hills around Oxford St during the closure. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time as delays are expected on detour routes including Cleveland St, William St and Darlinghurst Rd.

Road closures from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March

  • Oxford St between College St and Flinders St
  • Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St
  • Local side streets off Oxford and Flinders streets will also be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 12.01am Saturday 4 March until 4.30am Monday 6 March on Oxford St, Flinders St, Forbes St, Albion St, Crown St, Liverpool St, South Dowling St, Wentworth Ave and surrounding local roads.

Closures and clearways for Pride Villages on Riley St, Crown St and surrounding local roads remain in place until 4.30am Mon 6 March.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert and miss stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride Rainbow Republic will be the final event to close out the WorldPride festival kicking off from 3pm, finishing by 10pm.

With more than 20,000 people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD including Macquarie St, College St and William St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area. Roads will be closed within and outside the Domain to allow crowds to safely arrive and leave the event.

Road closures:

From 7pm to 11.30pm

  • Art Gallery Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd, and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

From 9pm to 11.30pm

  • Cathedral St from St Mary’s Rd
  • College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd (cycleway will also be closed)
  • Hospital Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd 
  • Prince Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • St Mary’s Rd between Yurong Pkwy and Prince Albert Rd

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the Domain from 6pm to 11.30pm on College St, Hospital Rd, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, Shakespeare Pl, St James Rd and St Mary’s Rd. Clearways will also be in effect on the eastern side of Hospital Rd from 12pm midday to 11.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Art Gallery Road, Macquarie Street, College Street

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Parramatta Eels v Melbourne Storm at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:50pm, finish around 9:35pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as 20,000 fans travel to the game during the busy Thursday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour between 9.30pm and 10.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Snoop Dog at Qudos Bank Arena. Start both nights 7pm. Finish both nights approx 10pm

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the eve.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
The Moruya Mardi Gras Street Parade will take place on Saturday 11 March 2023 from 1pm to 3pm.


Traffic will be held on the Princes Highway whilst the march crosses the Princes Highway at Church Street.


Please exercise caution in the area as there will be high pedestrian activity.

The Australian Alpine Ascent will consist with two days of Trail Running events, within the Kosciuszko National Park.

Speed reductions will be in place on Kosciuszko Road around Perisher resort and Charlotte Pass. Motorists should follow the directions of traffic control, reduce speed and drive with caution when in the area.

webLinks.linkText: Cinema under the stars event page

properties.otherAdvice:
Cinema under the stars will be held at Speers Point Park, The Esplanade from 5pm to 10.30pm Saturday 4 March.

On the Esplanade just near Park Road there will be a portable signalised pedestrian crossing to allow for the increase in pedestrian activity.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, reduce speed and watch for pedestrians.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services will be temporarily held at stops while the march crosses the tracks at Town Hall. Buses may also be affected while roads are closed. Allow extra travel time and follow directions of NSW Police and transport staff on site. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD between 12.45pm and 3pm for a planned protest march Police Operation. The march is now expected to proceed on Park Street, College Street and terminate at Hyde Park North.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

roads.mainStreet: Park Street, College Street, Hyde Park North
